content.question: <math alttext="the limit as n approaches infinity, of, the sum from k equals 1 to n, of, open parenthesis, the fraction 3 over n, end fraction, times k, close parenthesis, squared, times, the fraction 3 over n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><msup><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is
